Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different plants and animals in their natural habitats.
The student can represent and identify the places where different plants and animals live (e.g., water for fish, forests for deer).
The student can demonstrate the relationship between plants, animals, and the resources they need (e.g., water, air, sunlight).
The student can show how specific animals and plants meet their needs in their environments (e.g., deer eating leaves, plants growing in sunlight).
The student can describe through drawing how plants, animals, and their environments work together as a system to meet the needs of living things.
